headline: Ask HN: Should SysAdmin Day Be Renamed to “DevOps Day”?
description:
SysAdmin seems like a term from long time ago, where admins mounted hardware in 19" racks, installed cables and were typically found in a dark room with tons of hardware pieces, sitting in front of a display with an terminal and installing a Linux distro manually.

Today's admin work (if you can call it still "admin work") is completely different: Writing YAML code for your automation tools, checking the CI/CD pipeline and deploying stuff to the cloud. The industry gave this kind of work the term "DevOps".

Classic sysadmins are an extinct species. Shouldn't this day therefore not better be called "DevOps Day"?

Happy SysAdmin Day :-)
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: SysAdmin Day应该改名为 "DevOps Day "吗？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: SysAdmin Day應該改名為 "DevOps Day "嗎？
description_zh-Hans:
SysAdmin似乎是一个很久以前的术语，管理员在19"机架上安装硬件，安装电缆，通常被发现在一个有大量硬件部件的黑暗房间里，坐在显示器前用终端手动安装Linux发行版。为你的自动化工具编写YAML代码，检查CI/CD管道并将东西部署到云端。业界将这种工作称为"DevOps"。

经典的系统管理员是一个灭绝的物种。因此，这一天不应该被称为"DevOps Day"吗？

祝系统管理员日快乐 :-)
description_zh-Hant:
SysAdmin似乎是一個很久以前的術語，管理員在19"機架上安裝硬件，安裝電纜，通常被發現在一個有大量硬件部件的黑暗房間裡，坐在顯示器前用終端手動安裝Linux發行版。為你的自動化工具編寫YAML代碼，檢查CI/CD管道並將東西部署到雲端。業界將這種工作稱為"DevOps"。

經典的系統管理員是一個滅絕的物種。因此，這一天不應該被稱為"DevOps Day"嗎？

祝系統管理員日快樂 :-)
